sg.edu.cs2103aug2015_w13_2j.filters

Class FilterChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • sg.edu.cs2103aug2015_w13_2j.filters.FilterChain

  • public class FilterChain
extends java.lang.Object
    The FilterChain class encapsulates a Stack of Filter objects and provides methods to push and pop Filter objects to the Stack.
    Author:
    Zhu Chunqi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FilterChain()
      Zero-parameter constructor.
      FilterChain(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
      Class constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getFilterChain()
      Retrieves a string representation of all the Filter objects in the filter chain stack.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasks()
      Retrieves a sorted list of Task objects from the root Filter object in the filter chain, i.e.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasksForDisplay()
      Retrieves a sorted list of Task objects after being filtered through the filter chain.
      Filter popFilter()
      Pops and returns the final Filter object from the filter chain stack.
      void pushFilter(Filter filter)
      Adds the provided Filter object to the filter chain stack and applies its filter functionality.
      int size()
      Retrieves the size of the filter chain stack.
      void updateFilters()
      Updates all Filters in the filter chain stack by chaining calls to Filter.applyFilter(ArrayList), beginning with the list of Task objects in the root Filter.
      void updateFilters(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
      Re-seeds the filter chain with the provided list of Task objects.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterChain

        public FilterChain()
        Zero-parameter constructor. Internally calls the alternative constructor FilterChain(ArrayList) with a new empty list.

      • FilterChain

        public FilterChain(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
        Class constructor. Initializes a new IdentityFilter as the root of the filter chain stack seeded with the provided list of Task objects.
        Parameters:
        tasks - List of Task objects to seed the root Filter object.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Retrieves the size of the filter chain stack. The number returned is always at least 1 as the root IdentityFilter cannot be removed.
        Returns:
        Number of Filter objects in this FilterChain.

      • getTasksForDisplay

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasksForDisplay()
        Retrieves a sorted list of Task objects after being filtered through the filter chain.
        Returns:
        Sorted list of Task objects.

      • getTasks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasks()
        Retrieves a sorted list of Task objects from the root Filter object in the filter chain, i.e. the list of Task objects that this FilterChain was seeded with.
        Returns:
        Sorted list of Task objects.

      • updateFilters

        public void updateFilters()
        Updates all Filters in the filter chain stack by chaining calls to Filter.applyFilter(ArrayList), beginning with the list of Task objects in the root Filter.

      • updateFilters

        public void updateFilters(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
        Re-seeds the filter chain with the provided list of Task objects. Internally calls Filter.applyFilter(ArrayList) on the root Filter object with the provided list of Task objects and then propagates the changes by calling updateFilters().
        Parameters:
        tasks - List of Task objects to seed the root Filter.

      • pushFilter

        public void pushFilter(Filter filter)
        Adds the provided Filter object to the filter chain stack and applies its filter functionality. It then becomes the final filter from which the indices of displayed Task objects are derived.
        Parameters:
        filter - Filter object to add to the filter chain stack.

      • popFilter

        public Filter popFilter()
        Pops and returns the final Filter object from the filter chain stack. If only the root IdentityFilter left, this method does nothing and returns null.
        Returns:
        Popped Filter or null if only the root IdentityFilter is left.

      • getFilterChain

        public java.lang.String getFilterChain()
        Retrieves a string representation of all the Filter objects in the filter chain stack. The name of each Filter object is retrieved via Filter.getFilterName() and appended with / as the separator.
        Returns:
        String representation of all the Filter objects in the filter chain stack.
